intro: Leucopogon malayanus subsp. novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
